translations.author: Lars Bitsch-Larsen
Haukeland University Hospital of Bergen, Norway
translations.accreditation: MD, DEAA, MBA, spec in anesthesia, spec in tropical medicine.

details.misuse: لا يستخدم لتحديد حالات الحدوث في جانب واحد أو في الجانبين - حيث إن ذلك متعلق بتقييم قد يتضمن العديد من الأماكن
*Not for specifiying unilateral/bilateral occurence - this is related to an evaluation which perhaps includes multiple locations.(en)

details.purpose: To record details about a single physical location on the human body in terms of its relationship to other anatomical landmarks.
details.use:
Use to record details about a single physical location in the human body. It may be neccessary to describe the physical location using more than one relative location - for example, 2 cm inferior to 'landmark A' and 3 cm medial to 'landmark B'. This archetype is designed to be used within the context of other ENTRY or CLUSTER archetypes and soley to provide a structured and consistent way to represent identified body sites.
In practice, some archetypes carry a single data element for carrying a simple description of body site - for example, OBSERVATION.blood_pressure and CLUSTER.symptom when describing ear pain. In this situation, where the value set is predictable and simple to define, this is a very accurate and pragmatic way to record the site in the body and to query at a later date.
However in the situation where the anatomical location is not able to be named as a specific site, it may be more flexible to use this archetype. For example, the CLUSTER.symptom archetype also carries a SLOT for 'Complex Body Location' which can hold both this archetype plus the CLUSTER.anatomical_location to support maximal flexibility.
details.misuse:
Not to be used for specifiying unilateral/bilateral occurence - this is related to an evaluation which perhaps includes multiple locations.
Not to be used to specify a specific location of a named physical site in the body. Use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location for this purpose.
Not to be used as a stand-alone archetype.

details.purpose: For registrering av detaljer om et anatomisk sted.
details.misuse: Anvendes ikke for spesifisering av unilateral/bilateral forekomst - dette relateres til en vurdering som kanskje omfatter flere steder.

description.other_contributors: Ian McNicoll, freshEHR Clinical Informatics, United Kingdom (Editor)
Dunmail Hodkinson, Black Pear Software Ltd, UK
description.other_details:
Use cases:
- 5LICS, midclavicular line
- L forearm, 2cm anterior to the cubital fossa
- Right iliac fossa
- 5 cm below L tibial tuberosity
- 2 cm medial to R nipple
- 4 cm below R costal margin in midclavicular line
- R femur
- midline nose
- medial aspect of R great toe nail.
